intro: Polypodium angustifolium var. taeniosum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf huperzia, is a fern native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves that are typically 10–30 cm long. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky slopes. Its sporangia are clustered in strobili on the underside of the fertile fronds. This variety is noted for its slow growth and is often used in horticultural settings for its ornamental value.
